page.title: 04SCHOOL DEVELOPMENT
page.content: In 1941 the school was taken over by the state.Until 1945 children up to 14 years of age went to the school.In that year it changed status to a primary school.Then in 1973 it became a first school in the educational re-organisation that took place in Buckinghamshire. In the past the children all came from the locality.The opposite is true today with all 30 children on roll coming in to the school from nearby districts.The headteacher gives the reason of a small friendly school as to its continual popularity.One example of this community is the fact that every child stays to school dinners. A first school in Bucks. caters from rising fives to eight year olds.
